synopsis: In this engaging episode of 'Pineapple Blunt Rotation,' hosts Devam and Ahir, joined by guest Gara, delve deep into the complexities of breakups and personal growth. They share their unique experiences, coping mechanisms, and the importance of self-reflection, ultimately highlighting the journey towards healing and self-acceptance.
quotes: You have to learn how to exist because otherwise, it starts feeling like there's some kind of ghost.
I realized that my happiness is worth something, even if it's just me.
Sometimes you just need to accept that happiness is okay.
If you don't put it into practice every day, then all the time's going to go by and I'm still just theorizing about these things.
I am the sky, not the clouds.
When you realize that your brain is a machine, you can separate it from yourself.
If I can't do it perfectly, then I won't do it at all.
You don't have to suffer; it's okay that the pizza is lukewarm and floppy.
I was just keeping myself busy and distracting myself with work.
I learned to give myself grace; it's okay to feel weak sometimes.
